III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/27/25, a staff member hit a youth in the back of the head
when the youth was trying to elope.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via telephone on 07/29/2025.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/28/2025.
Staff 1 denied Youth A being hit in the head at any point during
the incident on 7/27/2025. Staff 1 reported Youth A was restrained
due to self-harm attempts with a piece of glass on the sidewalk
down the street from the facility. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
restrained twice during this incident. Staff 1 could not recall which
other staff were present. Staff 1 denied having any concerns with
how the restraints were conducted and denied any injuries for
Youth A other than his self-inflicted cuts. Staff 1 initially denied
Youth A being taken to the ground for either restraint however
corrected himself reporting the second restraint was a supine with
Youth A having been on the ground with the glass and staff then
going to the ground to conduct the restraint. Staff 1 reported Youth
A did not complain of any pain or of anything or anyone hitting him
in the head following the incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/28/2025.
Staff 2 denied Youth A getting hit or hitting his head at any point
during the incident. Staff 2 reported Youth A was put in a standing
restraint due to self-harming with a piece of glass he picked up
outside. Staff 2 reported the first restraint was with himself on the
right side and Staff 1 on the left. Staff 2 reported the second was a
supine that was called when Youth A was already on the ground
with a piece of glass in his hand. Staff 2 could not recall all the
staff involved in this restraint however denied there being any
concerns or Youth A sustaining any injuries. Staff 2 reported
Youth A was released when he calmed and let go of the glass.
Staff 2 reported police were called to the scene.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/28/2025. Supervisor reported on the referenced date Youth A
was attempting to climb the gate between the street and the
employee parking lot so he stood between Youth A and the fence
so he could not do so. Supervisor reported Youth A then
2

proceeded to attempt to cut his arm with a piece of glass he found
on the ground so Youth A was restrained. Supervisor could not
recall the details of the restraint including which staff were
involved however denied remembering any concerns or any
injuries from the restraints occurring. Supervisor denied Youth A
was hit in the head or observing him hit his head on anything
during the incident. Supervisor reported Youth A accused him of
hitting him in the head. Supervisor reported Youth A was sent to
the hospital after the incident for evaluation.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/28/2025.
Staff 3 reported on the date of the referenced incident Youth A
was attempting to climb the gate to the employee parking lot and
when he was not successful in this due to staff blocking his way,
he moved away from the fence and picked up some glass from
the ground and began to attempt to cut himself. Staff 3 reported a
standing restraint was done at that time with two staff on either
side of him, keeping his arm with the glass away from reaching
himself to cut himself. Staff 3 reported this restraint was done by
Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 3 denied any concerns with the restraint.
Staff 3 reported a second restraint was conducted when Youth A
attempted again to get more glass and cut himself again. Staff 3
could not recall which staff were involved in the second restraint.
Staff 3 denied any concerns with the restraint and denied Youth A
being hit in the head at any time during the incident. Staff 3 denied
Youth A complaining of pain.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the hospital on
8/21/2025. Youth A reported everything was fine during his time at
the facility. Youth A denied being physically hurt by any staff while
at the facility. Youth A denied ever being hit in the head for any
reason or during any situation at the facility. Youth A denied any
concerns with any staff at the facility including Supervisor.
Documentation Review:
• Incident Report (IR) dated 7/27/25 authored by Supervisor
states Youth A was placed in a standing restraint when
attempting to cut himself with glass. IR states Youth A was
attempting to climb the fence to the staff parking lot and cut
himself on barbed wire from the fencing. IR states Youth A
was redirected off the fence when he attempted to retrieve
more glass from the ground. Youth A then became
physically aggressive and staff placed Youth A in a
standing restraint. IR states when released he went to the
ground and was placed in a supine due to still attempting to
self-harm. IR states when Youth A calmed and released the
glass he was released from the supine restraint. IR states
after initially calming down and stating he was done self-
3

harming Youth A escalated again and attempted to find
more glass. IR states police were called and Youth A was
taken to the hospital. IR documents Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3
and Supervisor were involved in the incident. IR documents
Youth A sustained cuts on his arm.
• Children’s Hospital of Michigan Discharge Instructions
document no injuries or complaints of head injury.
• Employee Disciplinary Records for Supervisor reflect 5
notations unrelated to the allegation investigated in this
report.
• Prohibited Intervention Policy states any physical discipline
is prohibited.
Video Footage Review:
• No video footage of this incident is available due to the
location outside of the facility. There is footage available of
Youth A walking towards the employee parking lot however
nothing else can be seen with regards to the referenced
incident.
Analysis There are no rule violations established regarding this allegation.
It was denied in all interviews including with Youth A, that Youth A
was hit in the head at any point during the incident. Medical record
and incident report did not include complaint or evidence of head
injury.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
